\( \newcommand{\set}[1]{\left\{ #1 \right\}} \) \( \newcommand{\tup}[1]{\langle #1 \rangle} \) \( \newcommand{\powerset}[1]{\mathcal P \left({#1}\right)} \) \( \newcommand{\card}[1]{\left\vert{#1}\right\vert} \) \( \newcommand{\proj}[2]{#1 \downarrow #2} \) \( \newcommand{\rel}[2]{#1 R #2} \)
Operations
Union $A \cup B = \set{x | x \in A \lor x \in B}$ Intersection $A \cap B = \set{x | x \in A \land x \in B}$ Difference $A \setminus B = \set{x | x \in A \land x \not \in B}$
Properties
Disjoint $A \cap B = \emptyset$ Powerset Set of all subsets, $\powerset{A}$. Cardinality of the powerset $\card{\powerset{A}} = 2^\card{A}$
Tuples
Projection The nth of a tuple $s$ is $\proj{s}{n}$. Cartesian product $A \times B = \set{\tup{x,y} | a \in A \land b \in B}$ Cardinality of the Cartesian product $\card{A \times B} = \card{A} \times \card{B}$
Relations
A relation of $A$ is a subset of $A \times A$.
Properties Reflexive $\rel{a}{a}, \forall a \in A$ Symmetric $\rel{a_1}{a_2} \rightarrow \rel{a_2}{a_1}, \forall a_1, a_2 \in A$ Antisymmetric $\rel{a_1}{a_2}, \rel{a_2}{a_1} \rightarrow a_1 = a_2, \forall a_1, a_2 \in A$ Transitive $\rel{a_1}{a_2}, \rel{a_2}{a_3} \rightarrow \rel{a_1}{a_3}, \forall a_1, a_2, a_3 \in A$
